metadata.title: CVE-2015-1301 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 45.0.2454.85allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impactvia unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-browser-l10n - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-chromedriver - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqmlscene - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '45.0.2454.85-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1097').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
